text: Ng'iya Girls High School is a girls' national school situated in Ng'iya Township, Siaya County, of Western Kenya. ==History and operations== The school was founded in 1923 as a primary school. It later became a teacher training college (TTC) in 1953. In 1962, Ng'iya Girls became a secondary school and admitted the first form one students who sat their “O” level exams in 1965. In 1971, the school enrolled the first A-Level science class offering Science and Arts A-Level classes. This continued till 1989, when the A-level system was phased out. The school was identified as a Centre of Excellence in 2010 and was officially promoted to a national school in 2012. In 2018, the school was closed as a result of being damaged by students due to unrest regarding the school's management. ==Notable alumnae== * Grace Ogot, author, nurse, journalist, politician and diplomat * Mary Abukutsa-Onyango, humanitarian and agricultural scientist * Grace Onyango, politician ==See also== * Education in Kenya * List of schools in Kenya ==References== Category:1920s establishments in Kenya Category:1923 establishments in the British Empire Category:1923 establishments in Africa Category:Education in Nyanza Province Category:Educational institutions established in 1923 Category:Elementary and primary schools Category:Girls' schools in Kenya Category:Secondary schools in Kenya Category:Siaya County
title: Ng'iya Girls High School
